triples.name: Propositional logic
triples.relevance: Propositional logic is the foundational concept that the paper provides algorithms and representation methods for.

triples.name: Boolean algebra
triples.relevance: Boolean algebra is the mathematical framework underlying the propositional encodings discussed in the paper.

triples.name: SAT solver
triples.relevance: SAT solvers are explicitly mentioned as tools for analyzing the propositional encodings generated by the paper's approach.

triples.name: Binary decision diagram
triples.relevance: Binary decision diagrams are explicitly mentioned as alternative tools for analyzing propositional formulas alongside SAT solvers.

triples.name: Constraint satisfaction problem
triples.relevance: Constraint satisfaction is one of the key application areas mentioned where propositional reasoning techniques are applied.

triples.name: Automated planning and scheduling
triples.relevance: Automated planning is identified as an application domain where propositional reasoning techniques can be applied.

triples.name: Cryptography
triples.relevance: Cryptography is mentioned as one of the diverse application areas for propositional reasoning techniques.

triples.name: Formal verification
triples.relevance: System verification is highlighted as a key application domain where propositional reasoning is essential for validation and verification tasks.

triples.name: Model theory
triples.relevance: The paper presents a novel model-theoretic account of propositional encodings for questions of logical validity using model-theoretic characterization.

triples.name: Validity (logic)
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a model-theoretic characterization of logical validity and introduces a unified setting for encoding validity checking in propositional logic.
